sense.name: a denomination within a larger religion
sense.commentary: SECT[+group][+social][+religious][+denomination] Note: does not imply a pejorative or radical connotation
sense.examples: As a Protestant, Mary was raised in the Presbyterian sect. They grew up in an Amish sect in southeastern Pennsylvania.

sense.name: a dissenting splinter group of a religion
sense.commentary: SECT[+group][+social][+religious][+splinter][+dissenting] Note: viewed as radical or heretical by the original related religion
sense.examples: They had their son deprogrammed after he joined a communal religious sect in Oregon. Members of the Branch Davidian sect in Waco, Texas barricaded themselves in a compound. His sect has been condemned by a number of senior Islamic mullahs.

sense.name: an ideological group with non-mainstream, radical views
sense.commentary: SECT[+group][+social][+ideological][+faction][+radical][+political/+philosophical] Note: related to sense 2, but does not imply splintering from a specific larger group
sense.examples: Greenpeace is regarded as a radical environmental sect by many. A nihilist sect in Tokyo deployed toxins in the subway system.
